title: Enforce, Change or Set Aside Determination

pages.name: Enforce, Change or Set Aside Determination

elements.name: enforceChangeSetAsideDeterminationDescription1
elements.body:
A parenting coordinator helps parents carry out their parenting agreement or order. They try to help parents solve disagreements about parenting arrangements. If you cannot agree, a parenting coordinator can make a decision for you. This is called a determination of a parenting coordinator. The parenting coordinatorâ€™s determination is binding and you both must follow it.

A determination of a parenting coordinator that is filed in Provincial Court is enforceable under the Family Law Act as if it were on order of the court.

On application of a party, the court may change or set aside the determination of a parenting coordinator if the court is satisfied that the parenting coordinator:

  • acted outside their `authority`, or
  • made an error of law or of mixed law and fact.

elements.name: filedOrder
elements.title: Has your determination of a parenting coordinator already been filed in a Provincial Court registry in BC?
elements.description: A document is filed in a Provincial Court registry when it is accepted for filing, a registry stamp is applied to the document, and it is put on a court file. Check your document to see if it has a registry stamp and court file number on it.

elements.name: RequiredDocuments1
elements.title: You will need to include a copy of your determination when you file your documents. You will be reminded to include a copy at the end of the service.

elements.name: enforceChangeSetAsideDeterminationDescription2
elements.body:
There are two ways to get a parenting coordinator to help you:

  • you can agree yourselves to appoint a parenting coordinator (sometimes as part of an agreement about parenting arrangements), or
  • a judge can order that a parenting coordinator be appointed.

elements.name: appointedDetermination
elements.title: How was your parenting coordinator that made the determination appointed?
elements.description: Select the option that applies and complete the date the agreement or court order was made.
elements.textBeforeInputs: {An agreement made on},{};{A court order made on},{}

elements.name: RequiredDocuments2
elements.title: You will need to include a copy of your determination when you file your documents. You will be reminded to include a copy at the end of the service.

elements.name: enforceChangeSetAsideDeterminationDescription3
elements.body: <div style='margin-top:-1.25rem;'>To file a determination of a parenting coordinator, the agreement to appoint the parenting coordinator must also be filed.

elements.name: filedAgreement
elements.title: Has the agreement to appoint a parenting coordinator been filed in a Provincial Court registry in BC?
elements.description: A document is filed in a Provincial Court registry when it is accepted for filing, a registry stamp is applied to the document, and it is put on a court file. Check your agreement to see if it has a registry stamp and court file number on it.

elements.name: RequiredDocuments3
elements.title: You will need to include a copy of your determination when you file your documents. The agreement has already been filed. You will be reminded to include a copy of the determination at the end of the service.

elements.name: RequiredDocuments4
elements.title: You will need to include a copy of your agreement to appoint a parenting coordinator and your determination of a parenting coordinator when you file your documents. You will be reminded to include a copy of the determination at the end of the service.

elements.name: existingDate
elements.title: Please provide the date of the determination of the parenting coordinator.

elements.name: agreementParties
elements.title: Please provide the names of each party to the agreement to appoint a parenting coordinator.
elements.description: Separate each name with a comma.
